intro: Potentilla geranioides var. geranioides, commonly known as the common potentilla, is a perennial shrub native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided into five to seven lobes, giving them a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
